ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Mendelsohn is a very engaging lecturer and is able to explain concepts clearly. However, at some points the lectures seemed quite repetitive and thus, I found the class could have gone into more detail or covered more material. The TA was fantastic.
Bringing everything I've learned at FES together: why pollution management is so important.
How new the subject material is in economics
The readings.
Survey of both methodologies and applications to pollution topics. Good lit review. Interaction with the professor. Great focus on climate change.
The best thing about this course was the sections. David Keiser was amazing at synthesizing the lectures of the week and getting everyone to understand.
The TA!

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Perhaps more student interaction.
Structure of lectures.
Nothing that I can think of. I really enjoyed the course.

The class should be more challenging and in depth, especially considering that the foundations class "Economics of the Environment" seemed to be a more challenging course in comparison and covered a fair share of the material.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Instructor was open to student questions. TA was excellent. Very good at distilling the lectures and answering all questions.
The TA was extremely helpful in section and review sessions and helped clarify concepts from lecture.
TA was great with availability and very patient and helpful. It would have been nice if the instructor had more office hours but was helpful when seen.
I went to all of the TA option discussion sections. They are incredibly helpful in digesting the material and determining the key points of lecture.
Both are available and helpful. I wish the problem sets were more challenging, however.
David Keiser was an amazing TA. He was extremely attentive and helpful to the students needs.
Te TA was extremely helpful and very accommodating to students.
The TA was very available and helpful. I did not attempt to contact the professor - so I can make no statement on his availability.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: A crucial part of the environmental economics program.
This course fits well into the undergraduate environmental studies program.

I think this could be a central class to people interested in working in environmental policy. If it were a bit more in-depth, I think it could be a central course to most of the different disciplines offered at FES.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To learn about the practicalities of pollution management.
To learn more about economic approaches to pollution management.
To learn more about the economic approach to pollution management
I will be working in the field of managing pollution.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes.
Exceeded expectations
Yes
Yes
No.
No, I thought I would learn far more than I did.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes.
To a point. There was a lot of overlap with Gillingham's intro course.
Yes
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Go ready with questions to start conversation.
Go to the discussion sections they will clarify the at times foggy lectures.
TA sessions are very helpful. Don't get bogged down in the small details of the lectures and just focus on the key points.
Make sure totake advantage of section. It's extremely helpful.
I would advise them to rethink it, and to make sure if they do take it to take what the professor says with a grain of salt and to go to the TA hours!
